Text: You're calling it XviD, yet on the info it says "CODEC: x264". Which one is it?

H.264 (x264) is what XVid is based on, and in my opinion a much better encoder. Only difference is XVid is free to use, and H264 is copyrighted by SOMEONE, and there is the possibility you could incur huge usage fees. I would much rather these uploads be encoded with H.264, and I don't think the uploaders are very concerned with copyrights....

Wouldn't worry about mislabeled uploads just so long as they are in the higher quality H.264

@ForbiddenSoul: You are clueless. Xvid is not based on h264. Xvid is an MPEG-4 codec. 

In any event, there is now a V2 version of this, with the "fog" look "corrected", but I believe this movie was filmed that way.
